answers.answer: Hi and thanks for using the forum.Since this has been going on for 4 days now, I think you should see your regular doctor.  There are a lot of things that can cause this (including the possibility of gallstones, a liver issue, and gas pains).  Abdominal pain is a very general symptom that can have many possible causes.  They need to be evaluated and ruled out by your doctor.  Hope this helps.Bridget
it has been going on about 4 days
So in other words, it doesn't hurt more if you just press down, but if I breath in against your hand it would hurt more

question: Hi,  I'm a 32 yr male who is moderately over weight.   I don't have diabetes or anything like that.     I started one day having this aching feeling over on the far side of my abdomen, maybe 3-5 inches below my right rib cage.   At first I wondered if I have a gall stone or something, but then I wondered if it was too low......then I realized that pressing around on the area doesn't cause extra pain, but breathing in past a certain point increases the pain feeling.   I would say it's a mild to moderate pain, not severe, but it's not normal...so the question would be does it seem like an organ or simply muscular or something like that?
title: Pain in abdomen, but mainly when breathing in
